channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Hi-GMAE: Hierarchical Graph Masked Autoencoders
item.description: To ensure masking uniformity of subgraphs across these scales, we propose a novel coarse-to-fine strategy that initiates masking at the coarsest scale and progressively back-projects the mask to the finer scales.

item.title: SPOR: A Comprehensive and Practical Evaluation Method for Compositional Generalization in Data-to-Text Generation
item.description: Our work shows the necessity for comprehensive research on different manifestations of compositional generalization in data-to-text generation and provides a framework for evaluation.

item.title: FA-Depth: Toward Fast and Accurate Self-supervised Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: Most existing methods often rely on complex models to predict scene depth with high accuracy, resulting in slow inference that is not conducive to deployment.

item.title: Evaluating Saliency Explanations in NLP by Crowdsourcing
item.description: The development of methods to explain models has become a key issue in the reliability of deep learning models in many important applications.

item.title: LighTDiff: Surgical Endoscopic Image Low-Light Enhancement with T-Diffusion
item.description: We further introduce a Chroma Balancer (CB) to mitigate this issue.

item.title: Heterogeneity-Informed Meta-Parameter Learning for Spatiotemporal Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Spatiotemporal time series forecasting plays a key role in a wide range of real-world applications.

item.title: ECR-Chain: Advancing Generative Language Models to Better Emotion-Cause Reasoners through Reasoning Chains
item.description: In this work, inspired by the emotion generation process of "stimulus-appraisal-emotion" in the cognitive appraisal theory, we introduce a step-by-step reasoning method, Emotion-Cause Reasoning Chain (ECR-Chain), to infer the stimulus from the target emotional expressions in conversations.

item.title: A Survey on Large Language Models with Multilingualism: Recent Advances and New Frontiers
item.description: To this end, we provide a survey with multiple perspectives on the utilization of LLMs in the multilingual scenario.

item.title: From Sora What We Can See: A Survey of Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: With impressive achievements made, artificial intelligence is on the path forward to artificial general intelligence.

item.title: Feature-based Low-Rank Compression of Large Language Models via Bayesian Optimization
item.description: To address the challenges of low-rank compression in LLMs, we conduct empirical research on the low-rank characteristics of large models.

item.title: SBAAM! Eliminating Transcript Dependency in Automatic Subtitling
item.description: Subtitling plays a crucial role in enhancing the accessibility of audiovisual content and encompasses three primary subtasks: translating spoken dialogue, segmenting translations into concise textual units, and estimating timestamps that govern their on-screen duration.

item.title: Blackbox Adaptation for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: There have been some attempts in the literature to perform parameter-efficient finetuning of such foundation models for medical image segmentation.

item.title: Analysis, Modeling and Design of Personalized Digital Learning Environment
item.description: We seek ways to establish a foundation for the seamless integration of FL into learning systems, offering a transformative approach to personalized learning in digital environments.

item.title: Efficient Multimodal Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: In the past year, Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) have demonstrated remarkable performance in tasks such as visual question answering, visual understanding and reasoning.

item.title: Reduced storage direct tensor ring decomposition for convolutional neural networks compression
item.description: The experiments, performed on the CIFAR-10 and ImageNet datasets, clearly demonstrate the efficiency of RSDTR in comparison to other state-of-the-art CNNs compression approaches.

item.title: Know in AdVance: Linear-Complexity Forecasting of Ad Campaign Performance with Evolving User Interest
item.description: We further condition SSM's global predictions on the accumulation of local results.

item.title: Tailoring Vaccine Messaging with Common-Ground Opinions
item.description: We define the task of tailoring vaccine interventions to a Common-Ground Opinion (CGO).

item.title: Language Models can Evaluate Themselves via Probability Discrepancy
item.description: In this paper, we initiate our discussion by demonstrating how Large Language Models (LLMs), when tasked with responding to queries, display a more even probability distribution in their answers if they are more adept, as opposed to their less skilled counterparts.

item.title: RDRec: Rationale Distillation for LLM-based Recommendation
item.description: Large language model (LLM)-based recommender models that bridge users and items through textual prompts for effective semantic reasoning have gained considerable attention.

item.title: CM-UNet: Hybrid CNN-Mamba UNet for Remote Sensing Image Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose CM-UNet, comprising a CNN-based encoder for extracting local image features and a Mamba-based decoder for aggregating and integrating global information, facilitating efficient semantic segmentation of remote sensing images.

item.title: Deep Data Consistency: a Fast and Robust Diffusion Model-based Solver for Inverse Problems
item.description: To address the challenges, we propose Deep Data Consistency (DDC) to update the data consistency step with a deep learning model when solving inverse problems with diffusion models.

item.title: Not All Prompts Are Secure: A Switchable Backdoor Attack Against Pre-trained Vision Transformers
item.description: The experiments on diverse visual recognition tasks confirm the success of our switchable backdoor attack, i. e., achieving 95%+ attack success rate, and also being hard to be detected and removed.

item.title: What should be observed for optimal reward in POMDPs?
item.description: This raises the question of how one should select an agent's sensors cost-effectively such that it achieves the desired goals.

item.title: Dynamic data sampler for cross-language transfer learning in large language models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have gained significant attention in the field of natural language processing (NLP) due to their wide range of applications.

item.title: Benchmarking Large Language Models on CFLUE -- A Chinese Financial Language Understanding Evaluation Dataset
item.description: The datasets and scripts associated with CFLUE are openly accessible at https://github. com/aliyun/cflue.

item.title: Smart Expert System: Large Language Models as Text Classifiers
item.description: Text classification is a fundamental task in Natural Language Processing (NLP), and the advent of Large Language Models (LLMs) has revolutionized the field.

item.title: Feature-Adaptive and Data-Scalable In-Context Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a feature-adaptive and data-scalable in-context learning framework (FADS-ICL), which can leverage task-adaptive features to promote inference on the downstream task, with the supervision of beyond-context samples.

item.title: DeepPavlov at SemEval-2024 Task 8: Leveraging Transfer Learning for Detecting Boundaries of Machine-Generated Texts
item.description: The Multigenerator, Multidomain, and Multilingual Black-Box Machine-Generated Text Detection shared task in the SemEval-2024 competition aims to tackle the problem of misusing collaborative human-AI writing.

item.title: Accurate Training Data for Occupancy Map Prediction in Automated Driving Using Evidence Theory
item.description: When converting the occupancy maps back to depth estimates and comparing them with the raw LiDAR measurements, our method yields a MAE improvement of 30% to 52% on nuScenes and 53% on Waymo over other occupancy ground-truth data.

item.title: Reinforcement learning
item.description: Observing celestial objects and advancing our scientific knowledge about them involves tedious planning, scheduling, data collection and data post-processing.

item.title: SecureLLM: Using Compositionality to Build Provably Secure Language Models for Private, Sensitive, and Secret Data
item.description: We reflect the compositional nature of such security mechanisms back into the structure of LLMs to build a provably secure LLM; that we term SecureLLM.

item.title: Libra: Building Decoupled Vision System on Large Language Models
item.description: Specifically, we incorporate a routed visual expert with a cross-modal bridge module into a pretrained LLM to route the vision and language flows during attention computing to enable different attention patterns in inner-modal modeling and cross-modal interaction scenarios.

item.title: IRSRMamba: Infrared Image Super-Resolution via Mamba-based Wavelet Transform Feature Modulation Model
item.description: This research advances IR super-resolution and demonstrates the potential of Mamba-based models in IR image processing.

item.title: Towards Task-Compatible Compressible Representations
item.description: We evaluate the impact of this idea in the context of input reconstruction more rigorously and extended it to other computer vision tasks.

item.title: Unsupervised Extractive Dialogue Summarization in Hyperdimensional Space
item.description: We present HyperSum, an extractive summarization framework that captures both the efficiency of traditional lexical summarization and the accuracy of contemporary neural approaches.

item.title: Beyond Static Calibration: The Impact of User Preference Dynamics on Calibrated Recommendation
item.description: Calibration in recommender systems is an important performance criterion that ensures consistency between the distribution of user preference categories and that of recommendations generated by the system.

item.title: Histopathology Foundation Models Enable Accurate Ovarian Cancer Subtype Classification
item.description: Five-class classification performance was evaluated through five-fold cross-validation, and these cross-validation models were ensembled for evaluation on a hold-out test set and an external set from the Transcanadian study.

item.title: DocuMint: Docstring Generation for Python using Small Language Models
item.description: Effective communication, specifically through documentation, is the beating heart of collaboration among contributors in software development.

item.title: Quantum Vision Transformers for Quark-Gluon Classification
item.description: We introduce a hybrid quantum-classical vision transformer architecture, notable for its integration of variational quantum circuits within both the attention mechanism and the multi-layer perceptrons.

item.title: TransMI: A Framework to Create Strong Baselines from Multilingual Pretrained Language Models for Transliterated Data
item.description: We applied TransMI to three recent strong mPLMs, and our experiments demonstrate that TransMI not only preserves their ability to handle non-transliterated data, but also enables the models to effectively process transliterated data: the results show a consistent improvement of 3% to 34%, varying across different models and tasks.

item.title: Hierarchical Attention Graph for Scientific Document Summarization in Global and Local Level
item.description: The long input hinders the simultaneous effective modeling of both global high-order relations between sentences and local intra-sentence relations which is the most critical step in extractive summarization.

item.title: DiverGen: Improving Instance Segmentation by Learning Wider Data Distribution with More Diverse Generative Data
item.description: Instance segmentation is data-hungry, and as model capacity increases, data scale becomes crucial for improving the accuracy.

item.title: 4D Panoptic Scene Graph Generation
item.description: To facilitate research in this new area, we build a richly annotated PSG-4D dataset consisting of 3K RGB-D videos with a total of 1M frames, each of which is labeled with 4D panoptic segmentation masks as well as fine-grained, dynamic scene graphs.

item.title: Revealing Hierarchical Structure of Leaf Venations in Plant Science via Label-Efficient Segmentation: Dataset and Method
item.description: Hierarchical leaf vein segmentation is a crucial but under-explored task in agricultural sciences, where analysis of the hierarchical structure of plant leaf venation can contribute to plant breeding.

item.title: Manifold Integrated Gradients: Riemannian Geometry for Feature Attribution
item.description: In this paper, we dive into the reliability concerns of Integrated Gradients (IG), a prevalent feature attribution method for black-box deep learning models.

item.title: How Far Are We From AGI
item.description: The evolution of artificial intelligence (AI) has profoundly impacted human society, driving significant advancements in multiple sectors.

item.title: Keep It Private: Unsupervised Privatization of Online Text
item.description: Authorship obfuscation techniques hold the promise of helping people protect their privacy in online communications by automatically rewriting text to hide the identity of the original author.

item.title: HW-GPT-Bench: Hardware-Aware Architecture Benchmark for Language Models
item.description: To this end, we propose HW-GPT-Bench, a hardware-aware language model surrogate benchmark, where we leverage weight-sharing techniques from Neural Architecture Search (NAS) to efficiently train a supernet proxy, encompassing language models of varying scales in a single model.

item.title: PL-MTEB: Polish Massive Text Embedding Benchmark
item.description: In this paper, we introduce the Polish Massive Text Embedding Benchmark (PL-MTEB), a comprehensive benchmark for text embeddings in Polish.

item.title: Dynamic In-context Learning with Conversational Models for Data Extraction and Materials Property Prediction
item.description: The advent of natural language processing and large language models (LLMs) has revolutionized the extraction of data from unstructured scholarly papers.
